meta.name: Loma Cultural Pattern Library
meta.notes: Each pattern represents a cultural transformation, not a translation. The 'typical_translation' field shows what Google Translate / ChatGPT / a naive rewriter would produce. The 'loma_mapping' field shows what Loma should produce — culturally calibrated professional English. Patterns with 'code_switched': true contain mixed Vietnamese-English input.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Anh [name] ơi, em muốn hỏi anh một chút ạ...
patterns.typical_translation: Dear [name], I would like to ask you a little bit...
patterns.loma_mapping: Hi [name], quick question:
patterns.context: Informal request to a colleague or mild senior
patterns.notes: Vietnamese kinship terms (anh/chị/em) create false formality. 'Ơi' is a casual vocative — not 'Dear'. 'Một chút ạ' (a little bit) is a politeness minimizer, not a content word.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Chị [name] ơi, em xin phép hỏi chị...
patterns.typical_translation: Dear Ms. [name], I would like to ask your permission to inquire...
patterns.loma_mapping: Hi [name],
patterns.context: Opening a message to a female senior colleague
patterns.notes: 'Xin phép' (ask permission) is a Vietnamese politeness ritual, not a literal request for permission. Drop entirely in English.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Kính gửi anh/chị,
patterns.typical_translation: Dear Sir/Madam,
patterns.loma_mapping: Hi [name],
patterns.context: When the recipient name is known. If unknown, 'Hi there,' or 'Hello,'
patterns.notes: 'Kính gửi' is Vietnamese formal salutation. In English, 'Dear Sir/Madam' is only appropriate for cold formal letters. Most professional email uses 'Hi [name]'.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em chào anh, em là [name] từ công ty [company]...
patterns.typical_translation: Hello, my name is [name] from [company]...
patterns.loma_mapping: [name] here, from [company] —
patterns.notes: Vietnamese formal self-introduction is too stiff for English professional email. Modern English prefers brief, confident intros.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em gửi anh email này vì...
patterns.typical_translation: I am sending you this email because...
patterns.loma_mapping: [Just start with the reason directly]
patterns.notes: Vietnamese often narrates the act of writing. English professional email skips this — just state the purpose.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em hy vọng email này đến đúng lúc...
patterns.typical_translation: I hope this email reaches you at a good time...
patterns.loma_mapping: [Omit — start with the content]
patterns.notes: Vietnamese courtesy opening. In English professional email, this wastes the reader's first line — the most valuable real estate.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Anh ơi cho em hỏi nha
patterns.typical_translation: Please let me ask you something
patterns.loma_mapping: Quick question —
patterns.context: Casual request opener, usually on Slack/chat
patterns.notes: 'Cho em hỏi' is a Vietnamese permission-to-speak ritual. In English Slack, just ask the question.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Mong anh/chị thông cảm cho em...
patterns.typical_translation: I hope you will sympathize with me...
patterns.loma_mapping: [Omit — start with the actual message]
patterns.context: Pre-emptive apology before a request or bad news
patterns.notes: 'Thông cảm' (sympathize/understand) is a Vietnamese preemptive face-saving phrase. No English equivalent that doesn't sound melodramatic.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Hi anh, em có việc muốn nhờ anh help
patterns.typical_translation: Hi, I have something I want to ask you to help with
patterns.loma_mapping: Hi [name], could you help me with something?
patterns.notes: Preserve 'help' from original. Transform Vietnamese indirection into direct English ask.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Anh ơi, em biết anh bận lắm nhưng...
patterns.typical_translation: I know you are very busy, but...
patterns.loma_mapping: [Omit the preamble — state the request directly]
patterns.context: Self-diminishing opener before a request to a senior
patterns.notes: Acknowledging someone is busy before asking them something is a Vietnamese politeness norm. In English, it actually makes the request feel more burdensome, not less.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Nếu anh có thời gian, em muốn nhờ anh xem giúp em cái báo cáo này...
patterns.typical_translation: If you have time, I would like to ask you to help me look at this report...
patterns.loma_mapping: Could you review this report by [date]?
patterns.notes: 'Nếu có thời gian' (if you have time) undermines the request. In English, if the review is needed, ask directly with a deadline.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em không dám làm phiền anh, nhưng em cần anh approve cái này...
patterns.typical_translation: I dare not bother you, but I need you to approve this...
patterns.loma_mapping: This needs your approval — could you take a look?
patterns.context: Requesting approval from a skip-level or VP
patterns.notes: 'Không dám làm phiền' (dare not bother) is extreme Vietnamese deference. In English, requesting approval is your job, not a disturbance.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em xin phép anh cho em nghỉ ngày thứ 6
patterns.typical_translation: I ask for your permission to allow me to take leave on Friday
patterns.loma_mapping: I'd like to take Friday off. Let me know if that works.
patterns.notes: Vietnamese frames leave as begging permission. English frames it as a notification with a courtesy check.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Anh ơi, em muốn xin anh extend cái deadline thêm 2 ngày được không ạ?
patterns.typical_translation: I want to ask you to extend the deadline for 2 more days, is that okay?
patterns.loma_mapping: Could we extend the deadline by 2 days? I need more time to [reason].
patterns.notes: Preserve 'extend' and 'deadline'. Add the reason — English expects justification with requests, not just the ask.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em không biết có phù hợp không, nhưng em muốn đề xuất...
patterns.typical_translation: I don't know if this is appropriate, but I would like to suggest...
patterns.loma_mapping: I'd like to propose [idea].
patterns.context: Making a suggestion to a senior
patterns.notes: 'Không biết có phù hợp không' is Vietnamese hedging before a suggestion. Drop entirely — if you're proposing it, you think it's appropriate.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Anh ơi cho em xin cái budget cho project này
patterns.typical_translation: Please give me the budget for this project
patterns.loma_mapping: I'd like to request budget allocation for [project]. Here's the breakdown:
patterns.notes: 'Cho em xin' (give me/let me have) is too casual for English budget requests. Frame as a formal resource request.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em muốn nhờ anh giúp em giới thiệu với bên đối tác...
patterns.typical_translation: I want to ask you to help me introduce to the partner side...
patterns.loma_mapping: Could you introduce me to the [partner] team? I'd like to discuss [topic].
patterns.notes: Vietnamese buries the purpose. English intro requests need a clear 'why' so the senior can frame it properly.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Anh ơi, cái PR này em cần anh review gấp, deploy trước Friday được không?
patterns.typical_translation: This PR I need you to review urgently, can we deploy before Friday?
patterns.loma_mapping: This PR needs review before Friday's deploy. Could you take a look today?
patterns.notes: Preserve PR, review, deploy, Friday. Restructure from Vietnamese question form to English request.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Nếu được, em muốn xin anh cho em tham gia project mới
patterns.typical_translation: If possible, I would like to ask you to let me participate in the new project
patterns.loma_mapping: I'm interested in joining [project]. Would there be room for me on the team?
patterns.context: Expressing interest in a new opportunity
patterns.notes: Vietnamese frames as begging for inclusion. English frames as confident interest.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em xin lỗi anh trước nếu em hỏi nhiều quá...
patterns.typical_translation: I apologize in advance if I ask too many questions...
patterns.loma_mapping: I have a few questions about [topic]:
patterns.notes: Pre-emptive apology for asking questions signals insecurity. In English, asking questions is expected and valued.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em xin lỗi làm phiền anh, nhưng cái invoice tháng trước chưa thanh toán...
patterns.typical_translation: I'm sorry to bother you, but last month's invoice hasn't been paid yet...
patterns.loma_mapping: Following up on [month]'s invoice ([amount]) — it's now [X] days overdue. Could you confirm the payment timeline?
patterns.notes: Never apologize for following up on money owed to you. State amount, status, and ask directly.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Anh ơi, em muốn hỏi thăm về tình trạng thanh toán...
patterns.typical_translation: I would like to inquire about the payment status...
patterns.loma_mapping: What's the status on payment for invoice #[number]?
patterns.notes: 'Hỏi thăm' (inquire/visit) is too soft. In English, a payment status check is a direct question.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em biết bên anh cũng bận, nhưng cái khoản tiền này quá hạn khá lâu rồi...
patterns.typical_translation: I know your side is also busy, but this payment has been overdue for quite a long time...
patterns.loma_mapping: This payment is now [X] weeks overdue. We need to resolve this by [date]. What's the best way to move forward?
patterns.notes: Acknowledging their busyness undermines your position. State facts and deadlines.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Anh ơi, cái invoice số 2024-031 amount $5,000 chưa process, anh check giúp em nhé
patterns.typical_translation: The invoice number 2024-031 amount $5,000 hasn't been processed, please check for me
patterns.loma_mapping: Invoice #2024-031 ($5,000) hasn't been processed yet. Could you check on this?
patterns.context: Code-switched payment follow-up with specific details
patterns.notes: Preserve invoice number, amount, 'process', 'check'. Clean up Vietnamese filler.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Khi nào tiện anh chuyển giúp em khoản còn lại nhé
patterns.typical_translation: Whenever it's convenient, please transfer the remaining amount for me
patterns.loma_mapping: Could you transfer the remaining balance of [amount]? A timeline would be helpful.
patterns.notes: 'Khi nào tiện' (whenever convenient) gives the payer infinite delay. Always ask for a timeline.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em gửi lại anh hóa đơn, anh xem rồi thanh toán giúp em nha
patterns.typical_translation: I'm resending you the invoice, please look at it and pay for me
patterns.loma_mapping: Resending the invoice for your reference. Payment is due by [date].
patterns.context: Resending invoice with polite but firm deadline
patterns.notes: 'Giúp em nha' (help me, okay?) frames payment as a favor. It's a contractual obligation.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em hy vọng anh thông cảm, bên em cũng cần tiền để pay vendor...
patterns.typical_translation: I hope you understand, our side also needs money to pay vendors...
patterns.loma_mapping: We need to close this out soon — it's affecting our vendor payments downstream. Can we finalize by [date]?
patterns.notes: State the business impact without the emotional plea. 'Thông cảm' (sympathize) is too personal for business.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Dạ em chào anh, em từ bộ phận kế toán công ty [company], em liên hệ về vấn đề thanh toán hóa đơn...
patterns.typical_translation: Hello, I am from the accounting department of [company], I am contacting regarding the issue of invoice payment...
patterns.loma_mapping: Hi [name], reaching out from [company]'s finance team about outstanding invoice #[number].
patterns.notes: Vietnamese formal self-introduction from accounting. Compress to one sentence — name, team, purpose.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em muốn confirm lại payment terms, net 30 tính từ ngày nào ạ?
patterns.typical_translation: I want to confirm the payment terms, net 30 counting from which date?
patterns.loma_mapping: Quick clarification on payment terms — does the Net 30 start from invoice date or delivery date?
patterns.notes: Preserve 'payment terms', 'Net 30'. Transform from Vietnamese question structure to English.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em rất ngại khi phải nhắc lại chuyện này...
patterns.typical_translation: I feel very embarrassed to have to remind about this again...
patterns.loma_mapping: Following up again on [invoice]. This is now [X] overdue.
patterns.notes: 'Ngại' (embarrassed/awkward) has no place in payment collection. It's your money. Follow up without shame.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em không biết anh đã xem email em gửi hôm trước chưa ạ...
patterns.typical_translation: I don't know if you have seen the email I sent before...
patterns.loma_mapping: Following up on my email from [date] about [topic]. Let me know if you need anything from my side.
patterns.context: Following up on an unanswered email
patterns.notes: 'Không biết anh đã xem chưa' is indirect — it avoids implying they ignored you. In English, just reference the email directly.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em xin lỗi đã làm phiền anh lần nữa...
patterns.typical_translation: I'm sorry to bother you again...
patterns.loma_mapping: [Omit — start with the actual follow-up]
patterns.notes: Following up on legitimate work is not bothering someone. Remove the apology entirely.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Anh ơi, cái proposal em gửi tuần trước anh đã review chưa? Em cần submit cho client trước deadline
patterns.typical_translation: The proposal I sent last week, have you reviewed it? I need to submit to client before deadline
patterns.loma_mapping: Checking in on the proposal I sent last week. I need to submit to the client by [deadline] — could you review by [date]?
patterns.notes: Preserve 'proposal', 'review', 'submit', 'client', 'deadline'. Add specific dates.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em nhắc nhẹ anh về cái việc hôm bữa mình nói...
patterns.typical_translation: I gently remind you about the thing we talked about the other day...
patterns.loma_mapping: Quick reminder about [specific topic] we discussed on [date]. What's the status?
patterns.context: Gentle reminder about a discussed item
patterns.notes: 'Nhắc nhẹ' (gently remind) is unnecessary softening. In English, a follow-up is already understood as polite.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Chắc anh bận quên mất, em nhắc lại...
patterns.typical_translation: You were probably busy and forgot, let me remind you...
patterns.loma_mapping: Circling back on [topic] — any updates?
patterns.context: Giving them an excuse for not responding
patterns.notes: Vietnamese gives the other person face by excusing their non-response. English doesn't need this — just follow up neutrally.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Anh ơi cái document em share trên Drive tuần trước, anh comment được chưa ạ?
patterns.typical_translation: The document I shared on Drive last week, have you been able to comment yet?
patterns.loma_mapping: Have you had a chance to review the doc I shared on Drive? Need your comments by [date].
patterns.context: Google Drive document review follow-up, code-switched
patterns.notes: Preserve 'document', 'share', 'Drive', 'comment'. Add deadline.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em theo dõi lại vụ này, không biết có tiến triển gì mới không...
patterns.typical_translation: I am following up on this matter, not sure if there are any new developments...
patterns.loma_mapping: Any updates on [topic]?
patterns.notes: Vietnamese narrates the act of following up. English: just ask the question.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em gửi lại email phòng khi anh bị miss
patterns.typical_translation: I'm resending the email in case you missed it
patterns.loma_mapping: Resending in case this got buried. Let me know if you have questions.
patterns.notes: 'Bị miss' — preserve the concept but reframe. 'Got buried' is the English equivalent that saves face.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em muốn hỏi tiếp về chuyện hôm bữa, anh đã có câu trả lời cho em chưa ạ?
patterns.typical_translation: I want to continue asking about the matter from the other day, do you have an answer for me yet?
patterns.loma_mapping: Following up on our discussion about [topic]. Have you had a chance to decide?
patterns.notes: Vietnamese frames as 'continuing to ask' — which sounds nagging. English: 'following up' is neutral and professional.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em ping lại về cái này, anh reply khi nào rảnh nhé
patterns.typical_translation: I'm pinging again about this, please reply whenever you're free
patterns.loma_mapping: Pinging again on this — let me know when you have a minute.
patterns.notes: Preserve 'ping' and 'reply'. 'Khi nào rảnh' (whenever free) is acceptable in casual Slack context.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em nghĩ cái này hơi khó...
patterns.typical_translation: I think this is a bit difficult...
patterns.loma_mapping: I don't think this will work. Here's why: [reason].
patterns.notes: 'Hơi khó' (a bit difficult) is Vietnamese soft no. The listener is supposed to infer the refusal. In English, this reads as 'maybe' — which is the opposite of the intended meaning.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Chắc là chưa phù hợp lắm ở thời điểm này...
patterns.typical_translation: It's probably not very suitable at this time...
patterns.loma_mapping: This isn't the right fit for us right now. [Brief reason].
patterns.context: Declining a partnership or vendor proposal
patterns.notes: 'Chắc là' (probably) + 'chưa' (not yet) + 'lắm' (very) = triple hedge. The answer is no. Say no.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em rất muốn giúp nhưng hiện tại em không thể, em xin lỗi nhiều...
patterns.typical_translation: I really want to help but currently I cannot, I'm very sorry...
patterns.loma_mapping: I can't take this on right now. [One-sentence reason.] Could [alternative]?
patterns.notes: Vietnamese: express desire to help + inability + apology. English: state the no + brief reason + alternative.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Để em suy nghĩ thêm rồi em trả lời anh sau nhé...
patterns.typical_translation: Let me think more and I'll answer you later...
patterns.loma_mapping: [If the answer is actually no:] I've thought about it and I'll have to pass. [If genuinely undecided:] I need a few days to think this through. I'll get back to you by [date].
patterns.notes: 'Suy nghĩ thêm' (think more) is often Vietnamese for 'the answer is no but I don't want to say it now'. Context determines which version to use.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Anh ơi, cái scope này em nghĩ team mình không handle được, resource không đủ
patterns.typical_translation: I think our team cannot handle this scope, resources are not enough
patterns.loma_mapping: This scope is beyond what our team can deliver with current resources. We'd either need to reduce scope or add headcount.
patterns.context: Pushing back on project scope, code-switched
patterns.notes: Preserve 'scope', 'team', 'handle', 'resource'. Transform from Vietnamese disclaimer into English problem + solution structure.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em cảm ơn anh đã nghĩ tới em, nhưng em phải từ chối lần này...
patterns.typical_translation: Thank you for thinking of me, but I have to refuse this time...
patterns.loma_mapping: Thanks for considering me. I'll have to pass this time, but I'd be open to future opportunities.
patterns.notes: The Vietnamese version is close to good English. Minor cleanup: 'refuse' → 'pass' (softer), add forward-looking close.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em sợ là timeline này không khả thi...
patterns.typical_translation: I'm afraid this timeline is not feasible...
patterns.loma_mapping: This timeline won't work. We'd need [X more days/weeks] to deliver at the quality we're targeting.
patterns.notes: 'Em sợ' (I'm afraid) is Vietnamese hedging. State the issue directly and propose an alternative.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Cái này em nghĩ nên để lần sau, bây giờ chưa phải lúc...
patterns.typical_translation: I think we should leave this for next time, now is not the right time...
patterns.loma_mapping: Let's table this for now. We can revisit in [timeframe] when [condition].
patterns.notes: Vietnamese defers vaguely. English deferral needs a specific revisit trigger — otherwise it's a forgotten no.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em appreciate offer của anh nhưng current workload em đang overload rồi
patterns.typical_translation: I appreciate your offer but my current workload is already overloaded
patterns.loma_mapping: I appreciate the offer, but I'm at capacity right now. Could we revisit this next [month/quarter]?
patterns.notes: Preserve 'appreciate', 'offer', 'workload', 'overload'. 'At capacity' is the professional English equivalent.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Cái này không thuộc scope công việc của em, em không chắc mình nên làm...
patterns.typical_translation: This is not within the scope of my work, I'm not sure I should do it...
patterns.loma_mapping: This falls outside my current scope. You'd want to check with [person/team] on this.
patterns.notes: Vietnamese hedges ('not sure I should'). English redirects clearly to the right person.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Tôi xin tự giới thiệu, tôi là [name], hiện đang làm việc tại công ty [company], được thành lập năm [year], chuyên về...
patterns.typical_translation: Allow me to introduce myself, I am [name], currently working at [company], founded in [year], specializing in...
patterns.loma_mapping: [name] from [company]. [One sentence about why you're reaching out — reference something specific about them.]
patterns.notes: Vietnamese formal self-introduction is a company biography. Nobody reads it. Lead with why you're writing, not who you are.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em rất ngưỡng mộ công việc của anh/chị và hy vọng có cơ hội được học hỏi...
patterns.typical_translation: I greatly admire your work and hope to have the opportunity to learn...
patterns.loma_mapping: I've been following your work on [specific thing]. [Your ask or connection point.]
patterns.notes: Generic admiration is spam. Specific reference ('your talk at X', 'your article about Y') shows genuine interest.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Tôi muốn giới thiệu đến anh/chị sản phẩm/dịch vụ của công ty chúng tôi, chúng tôi đã phục vụ hơn 500 khách hàng...
patterns.typical_translation: I would like to introduce to you the products/services of our company, we have served more than 500 customers...
patterns.loma_mapping: [Specific value prop in one sentence.] Would a 15-minute call make sense?
patterns.notes: Vietnamese company pitch. In cold outreach, nobody cares about your customer count. They care about what you can do for them specifically.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Hi anh, em thấy profile anh trên LinkedIn, em muốn connect và discuss về opportunity hợp tác
patterns.typical_translation: Hi, I saw your profile on LinkedIn, I want to connect and discuss about cooperation opportunity
patterns.loma_mapping: Hi [name], noticed your work on [specific thing]. I'm working on [relevant project] — would love to compare notes.
patterns.notes: Preserve 'profile', 'LinkedIn', 'connect', 'discuss', 'opportunity'. But 'cooperation opportunity' is too vague — specify.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Kính gửi Quý khách hàng, chúng tôi xin trân trọng giới thiệu...
patterns.typical_translation: Dear valued customer, we would like to respectfully introduce...
patterns.loma_mapping: [Skip the formalities. Start with the value proposition.]
patterns.notes: 'Kính gửi Quý khách hàng' + 'trân trọng giới thiệu' is Vietnamese formal business template language. In English cold outreach, this is instant spam filter material.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em mong nhận được phản hồi sớm từ anh/chị. Xin chân thành cảm ơn.
patterns.typical_translation: I look forward to receiving your early response. Sincerely thank you.
patterns.loma_mapping: Would [specific next step] work for you?
patterns.notes: Vietnamese formal closing is too stiff. English outreach closes with a low-friction specific ask, not a formal thank-you.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em có thể gửi thêm tài liệu chi tiết nếu anh quan tâm
patterns.typical_translation: I can send more detailed documents if you are interested
patterns.loma_mapping: Happy to share more details — just say the word.
patterns.context: Offering to follow up with materials
patterns.notes: Vietnamese version is fine semantically. English version is more natural and conversational.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Hi anh, em là founder của [startup], bọn em đang build product về AI, muốn explore partnership với team anh
patterns.typical_translation: Hi, I am the founder of [startup], we are building an AI product, want to explore partnership with your team
patterns.loma_mapping: Hi [name] — I'm [name], founder of [startup]. We're building [one-line product description]. I think there's a natural partnership opportunity with [their team]. Open to a quick chat?
patterns.notes: Preserve 'founder', 'build', 'product', 'AI', 'explore', 'partnership', 'team'. Structure the pitch: who → what → why them → ask.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Với kinh nghiệm 10 năm trong ngành, chúng tôi tự tin có thể mang lại giá trị cho quý công ty...
patterns.typical_translation: With 10 years of experience in the industry, we are confident we can bring value to your company...
patterns.loma_mapping: [Remove credentials. Show value through a specific example: 'We helped [similar company] achieve [specific result].']
patterns.notes: Vietnamese leads with credentials and years of experience. English outreach leads with proof — case studies, metrics, specific outcomes.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Rất mong được hợp tác cùng anh/chị trong thời gian sắp tới
patterns.typical_translation: Very much looking forward to cooperating with you in the near future
patterns.loma_mapping: Looking forward to connecting.
patterns.notes: 'Hợp tác' (cooperate) is Vietnamese formal. 'Connecting' is the English professional equivalent for a first contact.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em làm tốt lắm
patterns.typical_translation: You did very well
patterns.loma_mapping: [Replace with specific observation:] Your analysis of [X] was thorough — especially the [specific section].
patterns.notes: Vietnamese positive feedback is vague ('tốt lắm' = very good). English feedback must be specific to be meaningful.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em cần cố gắng hơn nữa
patterns.typical_translation: You need to try harder
patterns.loma_mapping: [Replace with specific, actionable direction:] One area to improve: [specific behavior]. Try [specific action] next time.
patterns.notes: 'Cố gắng hơn' (try harder) is the most common Vietnamese feedback phrase and the least useful. It tells the person nothing about what to change.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Nhìn chung là được, nhưng có vài chỗ cần sửa...
patterns.typical_translation: Overall it's okay, but there are a few places that need fixing...
patterns.loma_mapping: Good work on [specific]. Two things to tighten: [specific issue 1] and [specific issue 2].
patterns.notes: 'Nhìn chung là được' (overall okay) is Vietnamese damning with faint praise. Lead with the specific positive, then the specific improvements.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em thấy phần presentation hơi dài, content thì OK nhưng slide design cần improve
patterns.typical_translation: I feel the presentation part is a bit long, content is OK but slide design needs improvement
patterns.loma_mapping: The content was solid. Two things to adjust: trim the presentation length (aim for 20 min max), and sharpen the slide design — less text per slide, more visuals.
patterns.notes: Preserve 'presentation', 'content', 'OK', 'slide design', 'improve'. Add specific, actionable direction.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em không muốn nói nặng, nhưng kết quả lần này chưa đạt yêu cầu...
patterns.typical_translation: I don't want to speak harshly, but the results this time didn't meet requirements...
patterns.loma_mapping: This deliverable didn't meet the bar we set. Specifically: [what fell short]. Let's discuss how to close the gap.
patterns.context: Delivering negative feedback, with Vietnamese softening preamble
patterns.notes: 'Không muốn nói nặng' (don't want to speak harshly) pre-apologizes for feedback. In English, direct feedback delivered respectfully IS the professional norm.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Cái code review này em thấy logic OK nhưng cần refactor, naming convention chưa consistent
patterns.typical_translation: This code review I feel the logic is OK but needs refactoring, naming convention is not consistent
patterns.loma_mapping: Logic looks good. Two items: (1) refactor [specific area] for readability, (2) standardize naming conventions — you're mixing camelCase and snake_case.
patterns.notes: Preserve all technical terms. Add specific examples to make the feedback actionable.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em cần phải chủ động hơn trong công việc
patterns.typical_translation: You need to be more proactive in your work
patterns.loma_mapping: I'd like to see you take more initiative — for example, [specific behavior like 'flagging blockers earlier' or 'proposing solutions alongside problems'].
patterns.notes: 'Chủ động hơn' (more proactive) is generic. English performance feedback requires examples and behavioral anchors.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Phần này em làm rất tốt, tiếp tục phát huy nhé
patterns.typical_translation: You did this part very well, keep it up
patterns.loma_mapping: [Specific positive:] Your [specific work] was excellent — particularly [detail]. Keep applying that approach to [future area].
patterns.notes: 'Phát huy' (develop/carry forward) is generic encouragement. English: connect the praise to a specific future application.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em cảm thấy hơi khó khi nói chuyện này, nhưng...
patterns.typical_translation: I feel a bit difficult talking about this, but...
patterns.loma_mapping: [Omit the preamble. Start with the feedback directly.]
patterns.notes: Announcing that feedback is hard to give makes the recipient anxious before they even hear it. Just give the feedback.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Overall performance em Q4 khá tốt, exceed target revenue nhưng teamwork skills cần develop thêm
patterns.typical_translation: Your overall Q4 performance was quite good, exceeded revenue target but teamwork skills need more development
patterns.loma_mapping: Strong Q4 — you exceeded the revenue target by [X%]. One area to develop: [specific teamwork behavior]. Let's set a goal around this for Q1.
patterns.notes: Preserve 'performance', 'Q4', 'exceed', 'target', 'revenue', 'teamwork skills', 'develop'. Add specificity and forward action.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em nghĩ khác một chút...
patterns.typical_translation: I think a little differently...
patterns.loma_mapping: I see it differently. [State your view with evidence.]
patterns.notes: 'Một chút' (a little) minimizes the disagreement. If you disagree, own it.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em không chắc cách này là tốt nhất...
patterns.typical_translation: I'm not sure this way is the best...
patterns.loma_mapping: I have concerns about this approach. [Specific concern.] What if we [alternative]?
patterns.notes: 'Không chắc' (not sure) is Vietnamese code for 'I think this is wrong'. Say what you actually think.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Anh ơi, em respect decision của anh nhưng em thấy approach này risky vì data không support
patterns.typical_translation: I respect your decision but I feel this approach is risky because data doesn't support it
patterns.loma_mapping: I respect the decision, but I'm concerned about the risk. The data suggests [evidence]. Could we revisit this before committing?
patterns.context: Disagreeing with a senior's decision, code-switched
patterns.notes: Preserve 'respect', 'decision', 'approach', 'risky', 'data', 'support'. Structure: acknowledge → concern → evidence → ask.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Nếu em được phép nói thẳng...
patterns.typical_translation: If I may speak frankly...
patterns.loma_mapping: [Omit — just speak frankly. The preamble signals that frankness is unusual, which undermines it.]
patterns.notes: Vietnamese asks permission to be direct. In English professional culture, directness doesn't need a permission slip.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em đồng ý với anh phần lớn, nhưng có một điểm em thấy cần xem lại...
patterns.typical_translation: I agree with you for the most part, but there is one point I think needs to be reconsidered...
patterns.loma_mapping: I'm aligned on [points of agreement]. The one thing I'd push back on is [specific point], because [reason].
patterns.context: Partial disagreement — agree on most, disagree on one point
patterns.notes: This is actually close to good English structure. Tighten and make the pushback explicit rather than 'needs reconsidering'.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Cái này em có concern, nếu go với plan A thì risk là timeline sẽ bị delay
patterns.typical_translation: I have a concern about this, if we go with plan A then the risk is the timeline will be delayed
patterns.loma_mapping: My concern with Plan A: it puts the timeline at risk. If we hit [specific scenario], we'll miss the deadline by [estimate]. Plan B would give us more margin.
patterns.notes: Preserve 'concern', 'go', 'plan A', 'risk', 'timeline', 'delay'. Add specificity — vague risk statements are weak pushback.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em ngại nói nhưng em thấy hướng này có vấn đề...
patterns.typical_translation: I'm hesitant to say this but I feel this direction has problems...
patterns.loma_mapping: I see a problem with this direction: [specific issue]. Here's what I'd suggest instead:
patterns.notes: 'Ngại nói' (hesitant to say) weakens the point before it's even made. Drop it and lead with the substance.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em biết anh có lý do, nhưng từ góc nhìn của em...
patterns.typical_translation: I know you have your reasons, but from my perspective...
patterns.loma_mapping: I understand the reasoning. From my perspective, [your view with evidence].
patterns.notes: Vietnamese version is actually decent structure — minor cleanup to tighten.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Cái strategy này em thấy không align với OKR mình đã set cho Q1
patterns.typical_translation: This strategy I feel doesn't align with the OKR we set for Q1
patterns.loma_mapping: This strategy doesn't align with our Q1 OKRs. Specifically, [which OKR] would be impacted. Can we discuss alternatives?
patterns.notes: Preserve 'strategy', 'align', 'OKR', 'Q1'. Add specificity on which OKR is misaligned.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em không dám ý kiến nhiều, nhưng em nghĩ mình nên xem xét lại...
patterns.typical_translation: I dare not give too many opinions, but I think we should reconsider...
patterns.loma_mapping: I think we should reconsider this. [Your reasoning.]
patterns.notes: 'Không dám ý kiến' (dare not give opinions) is extreme Vietnamese self-diminishing. Your opinion is literally your job.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em không muốn làm lớn chuyện, nhưng...
patterns.typical_translation: I don't want to make a big deal of this, but...
patterns.loma_mapping: [Omit preamble. State the issue directly:] We have a blocker on [project] that needs leadership input.
patterns.notes: 'Không muốn làm lớn chuyện' pre-apologizes for escalating. If it needs escalation, escalate without hedging.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em biết anh bận, nhưng cái issue này block cả team rồi, cần decision gấp
patterns.typical_translation: I know you're busy, but this issue is blocking the whole team, need urgent decision
patterns.loma_mapping: [Project] is blocked. The issue: [specific problem]. Impact: [team/timeline/revenue affected]. We need a decision on [specific question] by [date].
patterns.notes: Preserve 'issue', 'block', 'team', 'decision'. Drop 'I know you're busy' — structure as: problem → impact → ask.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em đã cố giải quyết nhưng vượt quá khả năng của em...
patterns.typical_translation: I have tried to solve it but it is beyond my ability...
patterns.loma_mapping: I've exhausted the options within my scope. Here's what I've tried: [list]. The remaining decision requires [leadership/budget/cross-team alignment].
patterns.notes: 'Vượt quá khả năng' (beyond my ability) sounds like a competence admission. Reframe as scope, not ability.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em ngại phải escalate vấn đề này nhưng SLA đang bị breach, customer complain rồi
patterns.typical_translation: I'm reluctant to escalate this issue but the SLA is being breached, the customer has complained
patterns.loma_mapping: Escalating: SLA breach on [account/ticket]. Customer has raised a formal complaint. We need [specific action] within [timeframe] to contain this.
patterns.notes: Preserve 'escalate', 'SLA', 'breach', 'customer', 'complain'. Drop the reluctance — this is exactly what escalation is for.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em không muốn mách, nhưng bên team kia không phối hợp...
patterns.typical_translation: I don't want to tattle, but the other team is not cooperating...
patterns.loma_mapping: We're blocked on [deliverable] due to a dependency on [team]. I've reached out [X] times without resolution. Could you help unblock this?
patterns.notes: 'Mách' (tattle) — Vietnamese frames cross-team escalation as childish reporting. In English, cross-team blockers are business problems, not personal complaints.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Vấn đề này em đã báo từ lâu nhưng chưa ai xử lý...
patterns.typical_translation: I reported this issue a long time ago but no one has handled it...
patterns.loma_mapping: This issue was first flagged on [date]. It remains unresolved. Impact is now [specific consequence]. Requesting prioritization.
patterns.notes: Vietnamese version is vague ('long time ago', 'no one'). English escalation needs dates, history, and current impact.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em tổng hợp lại situation cho anh: cái project đang delay 2 sprint, root cause là dependency với platform team chưa resolve
patterns.typical_translation: Let me summarize the situation for you: the project is delayed by 2 sprints, root cause is the dependency with the platform team hasn't been resolved
patterns.loma_mapping: Summary: [project] is 2 sprints behind schedule. Root cause: unresolved dependency with Platform team. Attempted resolution: [what you tried]. Needed: [specific intervention].
patterns.notes: Preserve 'situation', 'project', 'delay', 'sprint', 'root cause', 'dependency', 'platform team', 'resolve'. This is good structure — add what you've tried and what you need.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em sợ nếu không xử lý sớm thì sẽ ảnh hưởng tới khách hàng...
patterns.typical_translation: I'm afraid if we don't handle this soon it will affect the customer...
patterns.loma_mapping: If this isn't resolved by [date], the customer impact will be [specific: missed delivery, SLA breach, revenue at risk].
patterns.notes: 'Em sợ' (I'm afraid) + vague 'ảnh hưởng' (affect). Quantify the impact and specify the deadline.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em xin lỗi anh, em rất tiếc, em thật sự sorry...
patterns.typical_translation: I'm sorry, I'm very sorry, I'm truly sorry...
patterns.loma_mapping: Apologies for [specific issue].
patterns.notes: THE signature Vietnamese pattern. Three apologies in one sentence is cultural norm in Vietnamese but reads as panicked and insecure in English. One is enough.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Lỗi hoàn toàn là do em, em xin nhận trách nhiệm...
patterns.typical_translation: The fault is entirely mine, I accept full responsibility...
patterns.loma_mapping: This was my oversight. Here's what I've done to fix it: [action taken].
patterns.notes: 'Lỗi hoàn toàn' (entirely my fault) + 'nhận trách nhiệm' (accept responsibility) — excessive self-blame. English: acknowledge, then pivot to the fix.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em mong anh thông cảm và bỏ qua cho em lần này...
patterns.typical_translation: I hope you will sympathize and forgive me this time...
patterns.loma_mapping: I understand this caused [impact]. It won't happen again — here's what I'm putting in place: [prevention measure].
patterns.notes: 'Thông cảm và bỏ qua' (sympathize and overlook) begs forgiveness. English professional apology shows what you're doing to prevent recurrence.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em sorry vì miss cái deadline, em đã try best nhưng workload quá nhiều
patterns.typical_translation: I'm sorry for missing the deadline, I tried my best but the workload was too much
patterns.loma_mapping: Apologies for missing the deadline. I underestimated the workload. [Deliverable] will be ready by [new date], and I'll flag capacity issues earlier going forward.
patterns.notes: Preserve 'sorry', 'miss', 'deadline', 'try best', 'workload'. 'Tried my best' is a weak excuse — replace with accountability + new commitment.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em biết em sai, em hứa sẽ không lặp lại...
patterns.typical_translation: I know I was wrong, I promise it won't happen again...
patterns.loma_mapping: Acknowledged. Here's what I'll do differently: [specific change].
patterns.context: Promise to not repeat a mistake
patterns.notes: 'Em biết em sai' (I know I was wrong) is Vietnamese emotional accountability. English: skip the self-judgment, state the corrective action.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em xin lỗi đã reply trễ...
patterns.typical_translation: I'm sorry for replying late...
patterns.loma_mapping: Thanks for your patience. [Start with the actual reply content.]
patterns.notes: Minor delay apologies. For delays under 2 business days, 'thanks for your patience' is better than 'sorry for the delay' — it's a reframe, not an apology.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em gửi lại file đúng version, em xin lỗi vì đã gửi nhầm file lúc nãy...
patterns.typical_translation: I'm resending the correct version of the file, I'm sorry for sending the wrong file earlier...
patterns.loma_mapping: Correction: attached the right version. Apologies for the mix-up.
patterns.notes: Quick correction. Lead with the fix, not the apology.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em sorry anh, cái bug này do em merge code mà không test kỹ, em đã hotfix rồi, deploy xong trước 5pm
patterns.typical_translation: I'm sorry, this bug was because I merged code without testing carefully, I've already hotfixed, will finish deploying before 5pm
patterns.loma_mapping: Apologies — the bug was caused by an untested merge on my end. Hotfix is done and will be deployed by 5 PM.
patterns.notes: Preserve 'bug', 'merge', 'code', 'test', 'hotfix', 'deploy', '5pm'. Good structure already — just tighten.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Cái này... thực ra thì... em muốn nói là...
patterns.typical_translation: This... actually... I want to say is...
patterns.loma_mapping: [State the point directly. Remove all throat-clearing.]
patterns.notes: Vietnamese conversational stalling translated to English becomes painful to read. Delete and start with the actual point.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em muốn nói thêm một chút về vấn đề này, đó là...
patterns.typical_translation: I would like to say a little more about this issue, that is...
patterns.loma_mapping: One more thing on [topic]: [point].
patterns.context: Adding a point to a discussion
patterns.notes: Vietnamese preamble before adding information. English: be brief.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Theo ý kiến cá nhân của em thì...
patterns.typical_translation: According to my personal opinion...
patterns.loma_mapping: I think [point].
patterns.notes: 'Theo ý kiến cá nhân' (according to my personal opinion) is Vietnamese hedging — you're allowed to have opinions without disclaiming them.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Nói chung là...
patterns.typical_translation: Generally speaking...
patterns.loma_mapping: [Omit — start with the actual statement]
patterns.notes: 'Nói chung' adds nothing. Remove.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Anh thấy sao? Nếu anh ok thì mình proceed nhé
patterns.typical_translation: What do you think? If you're ok then let's proceed
patterns.loma_mapping: Thoughts? If this works for you, I'll move forward.
patterns.notes: Preserve 'OK', 'proceed'. Clean up Vietnamese question structure.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em attach file ở đây, anh download rồi review giúp em nhé
patterns.typical_translation: I attach the file here, please download and review for me
patterns.loma_mapping: File attached. Let me know if you have questions.
patterns.notes: Preserve 'attach', 'file', 'download', 'review'. In English, 'review for me' sounds needy. 'Let me know if you have questions' is the standard.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Vâng ạ, em sẽ làm theo ý anh
patterns.typical_translation: Yes, I will do according to your wishes
patterns.loma_mapping: Got it — I'll take care of this.
patterns.notes: 'Làm theo ý anh' (do according to your wishes) is subservient. 'I'll take care of this' shows ownership.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Dạ em note lại rồi ạ
patterns.typical_translation: Yes, I have noted it down
patterns.loma_mapping: Noted.
patterns.notes: Vietnamese adds politeness particles (dạ, ạ). English acknowledgment is one word.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em sẽ cập nhật progress cho anh hàng tuần
patterns.typical_translation: I will update the progress for you every week
patterns.loma_mapping: I'll send weekly updates on progress.
patterns.notes: Preserve 'update', 'progress'. 'For you' is unnecessary — who else would you update?

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em cảm ơn anh rất nhiều, em rất biết ơn...
patterns.typical_translation: Thank you very much, I am very grateful...
patterns.loma_mapping: Thanks — really appreciate this.
patterns.notes: Vietnamese double-thanks (cảm ơn + biết ơn) is cultural. English: one 'thanks' with warmth is sufficient.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Trân trọng cảm ơn anh/chị. Kính chúc anh/chị sức khỏe, thành công.
patterns.typical_translation: Respectfully thank you. Wishing you health and success.
patterns.loma_mapping:
Thanks,
[name]
patterns.notes: Vietnamese formal sign-off is a multi-sentence ritual. English professional email: 'Thanks,' or 'Best,' + name.

patterns.vietnamese_pattern: Em xin gửi anh cái summary meeting hôm nay, action items em list ở dưới, owner và deadline em assign rồi
patterns.typical_translation: I am sending you the meeting summary for today, action items I listed below, owners and deadlines I have assigned
patterns.loma_mapping: Here's today's meeting summary. Action items with owners and deadlines below.
patterns.notes: Preserve 'summary', 'meeting', 'action items', 'list', 'owner', 'deadline', 'assign'. Compress Vietnamese narration into clean English intro.
